capability_questions.question: Capability Question Is the process primarily manual or automatic?

levels.level_1: manual paper-based activity to accomplish tasks.
levels.level_2: automatic processes to accomplish tasks. Enroll Provider
levels.level_3: extent possible within the intrastate. SMA adopts MITA Framework, enrollment standard messages, and national standards within the intrastate that use standardized business rules definitions for consistent enrollment Provider Network information is shared with Health Insurance Marketplace (HIX). SMA produces audit trail of enrollment decision 100% of the time.
levels.level_4: to the extent possible within the region. SMA adopts MITA Framework, enrollment standard messages, and national standards within the region that use a regional standardized business rules definitions for consistent enrollment Provider Network information is shared with Health Insurance Marketplace (HIX). SMA shares Meaningful Electronic Health Record information with the Registration
levels.level_5: to the extent possible across the nation. SMA adopts MITA Framework, enrollment standard messages, and national standards nationally that use a national standardized business rules definitions for consistent enrollment Provider Network information is shared with Health Insurance Marketplace (HIX). SMA shares Meaningful Electronic Health Record information with the R&A

levels.level_1: and submits via facsimile, in person, or mail. SMA focuses on meeting compliance thresholds for state and federal regulations using state-specific standards.
levels.level_2: paper application but also has choices of data entry at government offices and kiosks. Electronic submissions are available and used. SMA applies a mix of HIPAA and state- specific standards. Enroll Provider
levels.level_3: nationally standardized electronic application from any location that has internet access. levels.level_4: interstate. SMA adopts MITA Framework, standard enrollment interfaces, and other nationally recognized enrollment standards for clinical and regional exchange of
levels.level_5: nation. SMA adopts MITA Framework, standard enrollment interfaces, and other nationally recognized enrollment standards for national exchange of enrollment

capability_questions.category: Business Capability Quality: Data Access and Accuracy
capability_questions.question: Capability Question How accessible is the information in the process?

levels.level_1: disparate systems including paper storage and obtains information manually.
levels.level_2: disparate systems, but automation and HIPAA standards increase accessibility over Level 1.
levels.level_3: assignment information easily and exchanges with intrastate agencies and entities based on MITA Framework and industry standards. Enrollment reports on the status of entire Medicaid population in graphical format for management use. Accessibility is greater than Level 2.
levels.level_4: assignment information easily and exchanges with regional agencies and entities. Accessibility is greater than Level 3.
levels.level_5: assignment information easily and exchanges with national agencies and entities. Accessibility is greater than Level 4.

levels.level_2: resolution, improving cost effectiveness ratio over Level 1.
levels.level_3: assignment standard messages, and other nationally recognized enrollment assignment standards further improving cost effectiveness ratio over Level 2.

levels.level_5: assignment standard messages, and other nationally recognized enrollment assignment standards for national (and international) information exchange. SMA increases cost effectiveness ratio over level 4.

capability_questions.category: Business Capability Quality: Effort to Perform; Efficiency
capability_questions.question: How efficient is the process?

levels.level_1: Process is labor intensive. There is wasted effort or expense to accomplish tasks. Process meets minimum state process guidelines and SMA performance
levels.level_2: Automation and state standards increase productivity. Efficiency is higher than Level 1. Enroll Provider
levels.level_3: SMA adopts MITA Framework and enrollment assignment standard messages with intrastate agencies and entities improving efficiency to 95% or higher.
levels.level_4: SMA adopts MITA Framework and enrollment assignment standard messages with regional agencies and entities improving efficiency to 98% or higher.
levels.level_5: SMA adopts MITA Framework and enrollment assignment standard messages with national agencies and entities improving efficiency to 98% or higher.

capability_questions.category: Business Capability Quality: Data Access and Accuracy

levels.level_1: opportunity for human error. Accuracy is low.
levels.level_2: business rules definitions reduce error and improve accuracy above Level 1.
levels.level_3: enrollment assignment standard messages with intrastate agencies and entities improving accuracy to 90% or higher.
levels.level_4: enrollment assignment standard messages with regional agencies and entities improving accuracy to 98% or higher.
levels.level_5: enrollment assignment standard messages with national agencies and entities improving accuracy to 98% or higher.
